lesson_html:
• Hello! - A common way to greet someone.
  • How are you? - A friendly way to ask about someone's well-being.
  • Good morning! - Used in the morning until around noon.
  • Good afternoon! - Used from noon until evening.
  • Good evening! - Used in the evening when meeting someone.

items.explanation_en: This sentence asks about someone's current state.
This question inquires about the current time.

items.en: do you have any plans for tonight?
items.explanation_en: This asks if someone has scheduled activities for the evening.
This question is about someone's workplace.

items.en: what did you do last weekend?
items.target: ¿qué hiciste el fin de semana pasado?
items.explanation_en: This asks about activities from the previous weekend.
This question inquires about someone's enjoyment during their holiday.

items.en: have you seen any good movies lately?
items.explanation_en: This asks for recommendations on recent films.

items.en: what are you doing this weekend?
items.target: ¿qué vas a hacer este fin de semana?
items.explanation_en: This question asks about future weekend plans.
This asks for a summary of someone's day.
This question inquires about someone's health status.
